I published a full article about this today — check it out here https://t.co/SeU1KLYh45 (6/6)
x509 certs also solve the original problem of lost private keys. If a user somehow loses theirs, a signing authority can re-sign a new key for them with minimal interruption to workflow. (5/6)

Companies using our blockchain, STRATO Mercata, can sign a certificate for an employee, then revoke it when they leave the company. No need to inspect the employee's device and no need to trust them not to make a backup copy elsewhere. (4/6)
That's where we've taken inspiration from a tool that has worked well on the internet for decades — x509 certificates. (3/6)

Multi-sig and social recovery wallets work great for this purpose if users don't need conditional permissions.
But what if you're a company who needs to authorize an employee only as long as they work for you? (2/6)

Regarding lost private keys, Satoshi once wrote: “Lost coins only make everyone else's coins worth slightly more,” and that users should, “think of it as a donation to everyone.”
We think there's a better way. (1/6)
